title: SOS!! Need to ID fonts ASAP
content:
Anyone know what fonts are used in Mother Earth News? Masthead, body text, headlines, subheads, cover callouts, etc.  
Thank you in advance!
author: mschief

comments.content: Too busy to provide scans, or are we all supposed to go out and buy copies?

I think the Masthead is Cheltenham Bold Condensed. It’s hard to see the body serif, but it looks like it might be Garamond or Sabon.

- Mike Yanega

The sans-serifs are Trade Gothic (or perhaps News Gothic).

The serif used for the “Greenhouses” head and deck is Kepler.
Thank you. I’m thinking the masthead is Aldine, sans AND sans serif heds and decks are both Trade Gothic, body is Garamond.

FYI, Aldine 721 is Bitstream’s name for Plantin Bold Condensed:  
 [http://fontshop.com/search/?&q=plantin+condensed&x=0&y=0&sample\_text=MOT...](http://web.archive.org/web/20091008034522/http:/fontshop.com/search/?&q=plantin+condensed&x=0&y=0&sample_text=MOTHER%20EARTH%20NEWS "http://fontshop.com/search/?&q=plantin+condensed&x=0&y=0&sample\_text=MOTHER%20EARTH%20NEWS")
